page.title: 06MELSONBY-The Quoits Club
page.content: The{game of QUOITS}has been played in this area for longer than anyone can remember. It was at its most popular as a{village pastime}in the {1920's & {30's }but then seems to have gone into decline. In the {mid-1970's}it{made a {comeback }when some 30 local villages formed the{ Zetland Quoits League} and when the game began to be played competitively in two organised leagues called the 'A'&'B' divisions. As its popularity grew, a third 'C' division was formed. In addition to {league competition each club holds its own {open {competition} when individuals play the game for prizes and trophies. There is also a {'WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP',} which this year was held in Northumberland. Some members even travel as far as {North Wales}on occasions to play. { Melsonby}is amongst the {top teams.
